alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 3:05PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...More Rain and Snow this Week as River Breakup Continues... A couple of weather fronts will move across the Interior this week bringing a mix of snow and rain to the area. A weather front Wednesday will weaken as it moves through the area with isolated to scattered rain and snow showers, while a second weather front on Friday will spread more rain and snow to the area with snow accumulations of around 1 inch in Fairbanks with up to 4 inches of snow possible in the hills and up to 6 inches of snow to the Alaska Range. Temperatures will remain cool across the area with lows in the 20s to lower 30s, and highs in the 40s to around 50. Rivers levels across the area remain elevated as breakup on the Yukon River continues. Breakup conditions can change rapidly so residents near the rivers should remain vigilant and be prepared to move to higher ground. For the latest river conditions go to www.weather.gov/aprfc. For the latest weather forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.
